original: “Business Day ” shall have the meaning given to such term in the Tariff.
ollama_generated: "For the purpose of this Contract, 'Business Day' refers to any day that does not fall under the categories defined as non-business days in the Tariff."

original: “Carrier” shall have the meaning given to such term in the preamble of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
"For the purposes of this Agreement, the term 'Carrier' shall be interpreted as defined within the preamble herein."

By slightly modifying the original wording, I aimed to keep the meaning consistent but subtly emphasize the interpretive aspect.

original: “Dedication ” shall have the meaning given to such term in  Section 7.1  of this Agreement Source: RANGE RESOURCES - LOUISIANA, INC., 8-K, 4/17/2015 “Delivery Point ” shall mean the delivery point at the interconnection of the System with DCP’s 6” Black Lake natural gas liquids pipeline and other mutually agreeable delivery points near Ada, Bienville Parish, Louisiana as provided in the Tariff.

The term "Dedication" shall bear the interpretation assigned to it in Section 7.1 of this Agreement, yet parties are hereby granted flexibility to negotiate alternative interpretations subject to mutual agreement.

ollama_generated:

This modification clarifies the term for readers and slightly softens its connotation, making it more approachable and less formal.

original: “Receipt Points ” shall mean the receipt points provided for in the Tariff at the tailgate of the Plants where Carrier accepts Product for transport on the System.
ollama_generated: "Tariff-Specified 'Receipt Points' " shall denote areas designated within the Tariff, at the loading dock of each Plant, where the Shipper offers the Product to be transported within the System, as managed by Carrier.

original: “Shipper Default Notice ” shall have the meaning given to such term in  Section 8.2(a)  of this Agreement.
modified: "The term 'Shipper Default Notice' shall be construed as per the definition provided in Section 8.2(b) of this Agreement, representing a reversal of roles."

original: “Shipper’s Dedicated Rates ” shall have the meaning given to such term in  Section 6.1  of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
"The term 'Shipper's Preferential Rates', as defined, shall be interpreted according to Section 6.1 of this Agreement."

This modification changes the original clause slightly by replacing 'Dedicated' with 'Preferential', implying that while the rates may still be fixed, they might not be as high or favorable as 'dedicated' rates would typically imply.

original: “Tariff Rate Revision Proceeding ” shall have the meaning given to such term in  Section 14.3 .
ollama_generated:
"Tariff Rate Revision Proceeding" shall be construed as encompassing any changes, modifications or adjustments to tariff rates as defined within Section 14.3.

The change here is that the original clause only referred to the term as having a meaning given in another section, whereas my revised version expands it to include any changes, modifications, or adjustments to tariff rates, not just the specific meaning mentioned in Section 14.3. This broadens the scope of what could be considered part of this proceeding, potentially reducing the obligation on one party to fully define every possible change or modification that might occur.

original: “Taxes” shall mean any or all current or future taxes, fees, levies, charges, assessments and/or other impositions levied, charged, imposed, assessed or collected by any Governmental Authority having jurisdiction.
ollama_generated:
"Impositions" encompass any and all existing or potential taxes, fees, levies, charges, assessments, or other obligations assessed, collected, or imposed by any governing body exercising legal authority. This term includes any new or amended taxes that may arise during the term of this agreement.

The revised clause is intended to broaden the scope of what is considered an "imposition" and emphasize the potential for future changes in tax law. It also shifts the responsibility slightly to the other party by including the possibility of new or amended taxes during the term of the agreement.

original: “Third Party Operator ” means an operator of a pipeline or other facility upstream or downstream of the System, other than Carrier or its Affiliates.
ollama_generated: "Third Party Operator" shall be construed as any entity that operates a pipeline or facility either preceding or following the System, excluding the Operator (Carrier) and its Associated Entities. In this context, 'Associated Entities' encompasses any entities that hold a substantial economic interest in or are under common control with Carrier.

original: ARTICLE V SHIPPER RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS 5.1 Tariff. Shipper’s nominations and tenders of Product for shipment, and Carrier’s scheduling, acceptance, transporting, measuring and delivering of Product, shall, at all times, be subject to, and implemented in accordance with the Tariff. Shipper shall comply with the Tariff at all times. The Tariff is subject to amendment by Carrier in accordance with  Section 15.1 .
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE V CARRIER RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS 5.1 Tariff. The Carrier reserves the right to adjust, at their discretion, their scheduling, acceptance, transport, measurement, and delivery of the Product, in accordance with the Tariff. The Shipper is expected to familiarize themselves with the Tariff and adapt accordingly. Please note that the Tariff may be subject to amendment by Carrier, as outlined in Section 15.1.

In this version, the clause shifts responsibility from the shipper to the carrier for scheduling, acceptance, transport, measurement, and delivery of the Product. Additionally, it weakens the obligation on the Shipper by stating they are expected (not required) to familiarize themselves with the Tariff and adapt accordingly. The Tariff is still subject to amendment by Carrier as stated in the original clause.

original: 6.2 Regulation Changes . Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, in the event that, after the Effective Date, any Governmental Authority promulgates, issues or changes any rules, regulations or other mandates that impose any material fee, charge or cost upon Carrier in connection with the performance of the Services performed hereunder, excluding normal fees, charges or costs that are incurred by Carrier irrespective of whether Carrier provides the Services on behalf of Shipper and excluding Taxes addressed in  Article XVII , then Carrier may increase the then-effective Shipper’s Dedicated Rates by up to ten percent (10%) to account for such fees, charges or costs (to the extent such fees, charges or costs are attributable to Shipper Product); provided, however, the cumulative effect of all such increases pursuant to this Section 6.2 may not exceed thirty percent (30%) of the initial Shipper’s Dedicated Rates (as the same may be adjusted pursuant to the Tariff from time to time). If, in Carrier’s reasonable judgment, an increase in Shipper’s Dedicated Rates of more than ten percent (10%) would be required to place Carrier in substantially the same economic position as it was in prior to the imposition or assessment of such fees, charges or costs, Carrier may call for a meeting among the Parties’ senior management to take place within thirty (30) Days of written notice to Shipper, and the Parties shall negotiate in good faith to amend the provisions of this Agreement such that the Parties are in substantially the same relative economic position as they were in prior to the imposition or assessment of such fees, charges or costs. If the Parties are unable to agree on an economic adjustment within sixty (60) Days of the senior management meeting, then Carrier may, in its sole discretion, terminate this Agreement without penalty by delivering Shipper written notice of Carrier’s intent to terminate. Such termination shall be effective, at the option of Shipper, (i) as of 9:00 a.m. on the first Day of the Month which follows the Month that Carrier delivered its notice of intent to terminate, or (ii) as of 9:00 a.m. on the first Day of the Month which is twelve (12) Months after such date, provided that Shipper’s Dedicated Rates for such twelve (12) Month period before such termination shall be increased to place Carrier in substantially the same economic position as it was in prior to the imposition or assessment of such fees, charges, or costs. Shipper shall exercise such option by delivery of written notice to Carrier of Shipper’s election within ten (10) Business Days of receipt of Carrier’s notice to terminate, provided that if Shipper has not responded to Carrier by the time described in clause (i) above, the Agreement shall continue pursuant to clause (ii) above.
ollama_generated:
6.2 Amendments to Regulations: In the event that any Governmental Authority institutes, modifies, or amends, after the Effective Date, any rules, regulations, or mandates which result in material fees, charges, or costs being imposed on us for the execution of our services as outlined herein, excluding regular fees, taxes, or costs that we incur regardless of whether we are acting on behalf of the Shipper and those addressed in Article XVII, the Shipper acknowledges and agrees that they will bear up to thirty percent (30%) of any additional charges accrued as a result. This percentage cap applies cumulatively to all such fee adjustments made under this Section 6.2.

If, based on our professional judgment, an increase in the Shipper's Dedicated Rates by more than thirty percent (30%) would be required to maintain our initial financial position prior to the introduction of these fees, we reserve the right to call for a meeting between our senior management and yours within thirty (30) days of written notification to the Shipper. During this meeting, we will negotiate in good faith to revise the terms of this Agreement so that both parties remain in substantially similar relative economic positions as they were prior to these fees being implemented or levied.

If an agreement on economic adjustments cannot be reached within sixty (60) days following the senior management meeting, we may terminate this Agreement unilaterally without penalty by providing written notice to the Shipper. The termination will become effective either:
- on the first day of the month following the month in which we deliver our intent to terminate, or
- on the first day of the twelfth month after such date, subject to an increase in the Dedicated Rates for the twelve months preceding the termination so as to maintain our initial economic position prior to the introduction of these fees. The Shipper must notify us of their chosen effective date within ten (10) business days following receipt of our notice, failing which the Agreement will continue under the terms outlined in clause (ii).

original: 6.3 Governmental Modifications . Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, the Parties acknowledge that the Tariff rates payable for all Services are subject to the approval of and modification by the FERC or any other Governmental Authority having jurisdiction.
modified: 6.3 Governmental Modifications . The Parties expressly agree that they retain the right, at their sole discretion, to adjust the Tariff rates payable for all Services in response to changes in the regulations imposed by FERC or any other relevant Governmental Authority having jurisdiction, without prior notice and without liability.

original: 7.3 Post-Commencement Date Facilities .
ollama_generated:
7.3 Obligations Regarding Post-Commencement Date Facilities:

During the term of this agreement and thereafter, each Party shall have the discretion to utilize or provide facilities as it deems necessary for the performance of its obligations under this Agreement. However, any failure or refusal by a Party to provide such facilities that are reasonably required by the other Party for the fulfillment of its obligations may be considered a material breach of this agreement, subject to resolution through the dispute resolution process outlined herein.

original: (a) After the Commencement Date, in connection with the construction of the Mount Olive Plant, Carrier will construct 13 miles of 8” pipeline between the Mount Olive Plant and the Lincoln Parish Plant, and a Receipt Point at the Mount Olive Plant.
ollama_generated: (a) Following the Commencement Date, Carrier shall be responsible for the construction of a 13-mile 8” pipeline connecting the Lincoln Parish Plant with the Mount Olive Plant, and establishing a Delivery Point at the Mount Olive Plant, subject to the condition that the scope of this obligation may be altered or rescinded upon mutual agreement between the parties.

original: (a) the occurrence and continuation of a material breach by Shipper of any of its obligations under this Agreement or the Tariff, unless such material breach occurs as a result of a breach or default by Carrier of its obligations under this Agreement or the Tariff; or (b) the occurrence and continuation of a breach under  ARTICLE XIII , Financial Assurances.
ollama_generated:
(a) the non-occurrence or prompt rectification of any material breach by Carrier of its obligations under this Agreement or the Tariff, unless such non-compliance arises due to a breach or default by Shipper of its obligations under this Agreement or the Tariff; or (b) the occurrence and continuation of a waiver or exemption from providing Financial Assurances as outlined in ARTICLE XIII.

In this revised clause, the obligation shifts from the shipper to the carrier, making it less likely for breaches to be enforced against the shipper, and instead focusing on the carrier's compliance with their obligations. Additionally, the focus has been shifted from a "breach" to a "waiver or exemption" in point (b), signifying a more lenient approach towards financial assurances.

original: (1) terminate this Agreement, any such termination to be effective upon receipt of the applicable notice by Shipper, in which event Shipper shall be liable to Carrier for (i) all of its accrued obligations up to and including the effective date of termination, and (ii) any and all other losses and damages sustained by Carrier as a result of or arising out of such termination; and/or (2) draw on any guaranty, letter of credit or other financial assurance provided by Shipper pursuant to  ARTICLE XIII , Financial Assurances. If Carrier terminates this Agreement pursuant to  Section 8.2(b)  hereof, Carrier shall be entitled to apply the proceeds of such financial assurance to Shipper’s obligations and Carrier’s losses and damages referenced in this  Section 8.2(b). In all other circumstances in which Carrier calls on any financial assurance provided by Shipper pursuant to Source: RANGE RESOURCES - LOUISIANA, INC., 8-K, 4/17/2015 ARTICLE XIII , Financial Assurances, following a Shipper Default, Carrier shall be entitled to apply the proceeds to cure such Shipper Default, and to hold the remaining proceeds as additional security for the payment and performance of Shipper’s obligations under this Agreement and the Tariff.
ollama_generated:
(1) This Agreement may be terminated by either party, with notice, in which case the termination shall take effect upon receipt of such notice by the respective parties. In the event of termination by Shipper, Carrier's obligations shall cease from the effective date of termination, and Shipper will only be liable for any accrued obligations up to but excluding the effective date of termination. Any additional losses or damages sustained by Carrier as a result of or arising out of such termination shall not be recoverable by Carrier. Additionally, Shipper's right to draw on any guaranty, letter of credit, or other financial assurance provided under ARTICLE XIII, Financial Assurances, will not be triggered upon termination by either party.

   (2) If Carrier elects to terminate this Agreement under Section 8.2(b) hereof, it shall have the right to apply the proceeds of any financial assurance provided by Shipper solely for the purpose of offsetting any outstanding obligations and losses suffered by Carrier in accordance with this Section 8.2(b). In all other cases where Carrier calls upon a financial assurance provided by Shipper following a Shipper Default, the proceeds shall first be used to cure such default, and any remaining proceeds shall serve as additional security for the future performance of Shipper's obligations under this Agreement and the Tariff. The rights granted to Carrier in this Section 8.2(b) are exclusive and no other remedies are available to Carrier.

Changes made:
1. Changed the initiative for termination from Shipper to either party, making it a mutual agreement.
2. Altered the liabilities of each party upon termination; initially, Shipper was liable for all accrued obligations and any losses/damages sustained by Carrier. However, now only accrued obligations up to but excluding the effective date of termination will be the responsibility of Shipper, while additional losses or damages sustained by Carrier as a result of or arising out of such termination shall not be recoverable by Carrier.
3. Revised the right to draw on financial assurance provided by Shipper; initially, it was triggered upon termination by either party. Now, it is only activated when Carrier elects to terminate under specific circumstances (Section 8.2(b) hereof).
4. Adjusted the use of proceeds from financial assurances in case of default; initially, Carrier could apply the proceeds not only for offsetting outstanding obligations and losses but also for recovering other losses/damages. Now, it can be used solely for offsetting outstanding obligations and losses suffered by Carrier in accordance with this Section 8.2(b). In other cases of default, the proceeds are first used to cure such default before serving as additional security for future performance.
5. Clarified that the rights granted to Carrier in this section are exclusive, meaning no other remedies are available to Carrier.

original: The rights and remedies under this  Section 8.2(b)  shall be in addition to all of Carrier’s other rights and remedies under this Agreement or the Tariff or which Carrier may otherwise have at law, in equity or by statute or regulation, and the exercise of one or more rights or remedies shall not prejudice or impair the concurrent or subsequent exercise by Carrier of other rights or remedies.
ollama_generated: The provisions outlined in Section 8.2(b) do not exclude, limit, or serve as a waiver of any other rights or remedies that Shipper may hold under this Agreement, the Tariff, or any other applicable law, equitable principle, statute, or regulation. The exercise of one or more rights or remedies shall not restrict or impede Carrier's ability to concurrently or subsequently assert other rights or remedies at its disposal.

original: ARTICLE IX WARRANTY OF TITLE AND PRODUCT INTERESTS 9.1 Title Warranty . Shipper warrants to Carrier that at the time Shipper Product is delivered to a Receipt Point hereunder, Shipper will have good title or the right to deliver such Shipper Product, and that such Shipper Product shall be free and clear of all liens and adverse Source: RANGE RESOURCES - LOUISIANA, INC., 8-K, 4/17/2015 claims, other than statutory liens and liens, encumbrances or claims under credit facilities or other credit arrangements in respect of borrowed money. Shipper agrees, with respect to the Shipper Product delivered by to Carrier hereunder, to indemnify Carrier against all suits, actions, debts, accounts, damages, costs (including attorney’s fees), losses and expenses arising from or out of any adverse claims of any and all persons to or against said Shipper Product other than any lien, claim or encumbrance alleged to have arisen by, through or under Carrier or its Affiliate.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE IX WARRANTY OF TITLE AND PRODUCT INTERESTS

9.1 Title Warranty . Recipient acknowledges that Carrier warrants to Shipper, at the time of delivery of the Shipper Product to a Receipt Point under this Agreement, that Carrier will possess good title or the right to receive such Shipper Product, and that said Shipper Product shall be free from all adverse liens, claims, encumbrances, or debts other than those created by statutory liens, liens arising from credit facilities or other credit arrangements related to borrowed money. Carrier agrees, with respect to the Shipper Product received from Shipper under this Agreement, to hold harmless Shipper against any and all claims, suits, accounts, damages, costs (including attorney's fees), losses, and expenses incurred as a result of or arising out of any claim by any person to or against said Shipper Product, except for liens, claims, or encumbrances alleged to have been created through actions by or under the Shipper or its Affiliate.

original: 9.2 Proceeds of Production . Shipper agrees to make payment of all royalties, overriding royalties, production payments, and all other payments for interests attributable to Shipper Product delivered hereunder due to any Person under any leases or other documents in accordance with the terms thereof.
modified: 9.2 Payments from Production. Receiver acknowledges that they are responsible for making prompt payments, as applicable, for all royalties, overriding royalties, production payments, and any other payments attributable to Receiver Product delivered hereunder, in accordance with the relevant terms of any leases or other documents governing such payments, without any claim or recourse against the Shipper.

original: 11.3 Termination Based on Carrier Force Majeure . If as a result of an event of Carrier Force Majeure, Carrier provides no Services to Shipper for a period of at least twelve (12) consecutive Months, either Party shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement by written notice to the other Party given at any time after the expiration of such twelve (12) Month period, but prior to the cessation of the applicable event of Carrier Force Majeure. Shipper’s termination right under this  Section 11.3  shall be subject to its compliance with  Section 14.2  in connection with any certificates, approvals, authorizations and permits required by Carrier as a result of the event of Carrier Force Majeure.
ollama_generated: 11.3 Termination at Shipper's Discretion due to Prolonged Carrier Unavailability. If for a continuous period of twelve (12) Months, the Carrier is unable to provide Services to the Shipper due to an instance of Carrier Force Majeure, either Party retains the option to terminate this Agreement upon providing written notice to the other Party, effective immediately following the expiration of such twelve (12) consecutive Month period. However, the Carrier's ability to enforce this termination right may be contingent upon the Shipper's compliance with Section 14.2 regarding any certificates, approvals, authorizations, and permits that the Carrier deems necessary in response to the event of Carrier Force Majeure. In essence, this provision empowers the Shipper to terminate the Agreement proactively, subject to meeting certain requirements specified by the Carrier.

This obligation applies even in instances where such negotiations fail to result in a resolution.

ollama_generated: (4) The disclosing Party shall only be obligated to share information upon receiving, in writing, the explicit waiver of the right to withhold consent from the non-disclosing Party.

original: If during the Term, Carrier has failed to pay any amount when due under this Agreement and if such non-payment is not being disputed in good faith by Carrier, Shipper shall have the right to request and receive from Carrier adequate Financial Assurance under similar terms and conditions as described above, including the right to suspend performance under this Agreement until such time as Carrier furnishes Financial Assurance.
ollama_generated: If, during the Term, Shipper determines that Carrier has not made a timely payment as required by this Agreement, and if such non-payment is not being contested in good faith by Carrier, Carrier shall be obligated to provide Financial Assurance acceptable to Shipper, under terms and conditions comparable to those described previously. Failure to comply with this obligation may result in Shipper's decision to temporarily suspend performance under this Agreement until such Financial Assurance is received.

original: 14.4 Third Party Proceedings . In the event of any Tariff Rate Revision Proceeding being commenced by a third party or by the FERC itself, and in the event of any other proceedings pursuant to which the Tariff rates for the System may be reviewed by the FERC or other Governmental Authority having jurisdiction, Shipper agrees to not object to the setting of Tariff rates applicable to the System that are consistent with this Agreement. In the event of any other proceedings challenging any of the terms of this Agreement being commenced by a third party or by the FERC itself, Shipper agrees to provide all reasonable support and cooperation in defending such terms or otherwise resolving the complaint or other challenge as shall be reasonably requested by Carrier.
ollama_generated: 14.4 Third Party Proceedings . In the event of any Tariff Rate Revision Proceeding being initiated by a third party or the FERC, or any other proceedings where the Tariff rates for the System may be subject to review by the FERC or relevant Governmental Authority, Carrier shall have the right to establish Tariff rates applicable to the System that are consistent with this Agreement, without Shipper's explicit objection. In the event of any proceedings challenging any of the terms of this Agreement being initiated by a third party or the FERC, Shipper is obligated to provide all reasonable support and cooperation in defending such terms or resolving the complaint or challenge, as may be reasonably requested by Carrier. (Note: This clause shifts the responsibility from Shipper to Carrier for setting the Tariff rates in certain proceedings.)

original: 16.3 Collateral Assignments . Either Party may grant a lien or security interest in this Agreement to any Person as security in connection with arranging financing for such Party or any Affiliate of such Party (and each Party agrees to execute all consents, estoppels, waivers and other documents and instruments reasonable requested by any such Person).

original: (b) Permitted Disclosures . Notwithstanding  Section 19.14(a)  of this Agreement, disclosures of any terms and provisions of this Agreement otherwise prohibited may be made by a Party (i) to the extent necessary for such Party to enforce its rights hereunder against the other Party; (ii) to the extent to which a Party is required to disclose all or part of this Agreement by a statute or by the order or rule of a court, agency, or other governmental body exercising jurisdiction over the subject matter hereof, by order, by regulations, or by other compulsory process (including, but not limited to, deposition, subpoena, interrogatory, or request for production of documents); (iii) to the extent required by the applicable regulations of a securities or commodities exchange; (iv) to a third Person in connection with a proposed sale or other transfer of a Party’s interest in this Agreement, provided such third Person agrees in writing to be bound by confidentiality terms no less restrictive than those set forth in this  Section 19.14; (v) to its own directors, officers, employees, agents and representatives; (vi) to an Affiliate; (vii) to a co-working interest owner or royalty owner of Shipper Product delivered hereunder, provided such co-working interest owner or royalty owner agrees in writing to be bound by the terms of this  Section 19.14 ; (viii) to the extent any such terms or provisions become public information through no fault of any Party; or (ix) to a bank or other financial institution, and their agents and representatives, in connection with a Party arranging for funding.

original: Source: RANGE RESOURCES - LOUISIANA, INC., 8-K, 4/17/2015 FERC ICA OIL TARIFF F.E.R.C. No. 1.0.0 “System” means Carrier’s pipeline system and all related facilities necessary for Carrier to provide transportation service from the Receipt Points to the Delivery Points.

original: A.Shipper shall not Tender Product for transportation on the System unless the Product will be readily susceptible to transportation through the System, such Product will not adversely damage the Common Stream or the System, and such Product otherwise conforms to the specifications set forth in this Item No. 3.
ollama_generated: The Common Stream and the System shall remain protected from potential harm during transport. It is the responsibility of the Shipper to ensure that only products which can be easily transported through the System, and will not cause any adverse impact upon it, are tendered for transportation on our system. Moreover, such products must comply with all specifications outlined in this Item No. 3.

original: C.Shipper shall perform applicable tests to ensure that the Product it Tenders to Carrier for delivery on the System conforms to the specifications set forth in this Item No. 3. Should spot samples, analyses, or any other test (including tests performed by Carrier) indicate that the Product Tendered or to be Tendered does not meet the specifications required by Carrier, Shipper agrees to stop delivery of such off-specification Product to Carrier until such time as it is determined by additional testing that the Product meets the definition of Product issued by Carrier.
modified: A.Carrier reserves the right to perform any applicable tests on the Product received from Shipper, to ensure its conformity with the specifications outlined in this Item No. 3. If, during these tests or any subsequent analysis (including those conducted by Shipper), it is found that the tendered Product does not adhere to Carrier's specified requirements, Carrier has the discretion to accept the off-specification Product under the condition that Shipper promptly provides additional testing to demonstrate that the Product aligns with Carrier's definition of Product. Shipper remains responsible for any costs associated with these additional tests and potential rejections.

original: Source: RANGE RESOURCES - LOUISIANA, INC., 8-K, 4/17/2015 FERC ICA OIL TARIFF F.E.R.C. No. 1.0.0 G.Carrier is not responsible for monitoring receipts or deliveries for contaminants. Further, Carrier reserves the right to dispose of any contaminated Product on the System. Disposal thereof may be made in any reasonable manner including but not limited to commercial sales. Any liability associated with the contamination or disposal of any Products shall be borne by Shipper introducing the contaminated Products into the System. Shipper liability includes, but is not limited to, claims from other Shippers, carriers, or users of the contaminated Products and the costs of any regulatory or judicial proceeding.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: RANGE RESOURCES - LOUISIANA, INC., 8-K, 4/17/2015 FERC ICA OIL TARIFF F.E.R.C. No. 1.0.0 G.Carrier holds no obligation to verify the cleanliness of Products within the System. Additionally, Carrier retains discretionary power to manage any contaminated Product found in the system. Such management may involve disposal or commercial resale, at Carrier's sole discretion. In cases where contamination occurs and disposal is necessary, the Shipper assumes all associated liabilities, including but not limited to claims from other affected parties (such as other Shippers, carriers, or users of the contaminated Products), costs of any regulatory or judicial proceedings, and potential damages arising from such contamination.

original: A.Carrier shall not be liable to Shipper for changes in gravity or quality of Shipper’s Products that may occur from commingling or intermixing Shipper’s Products with other Products in the same Common Stream while in transit. Carrier is not obligated to deliver to Shipper the identical Product nominated by Shipper; Carrier will deliver the Product it is regularly transporting as a Common Stream.
ollama_generated: The Transporter shall have no liability towards the Consignor for any alterations in gravity or quality of the Consignor's Goods that might arise from their blending or intermingling with other goods within the same Shared Freight Stream during transit. It is not obligatory for the Transporter to deliver to the Consignor the exact Product as specified; instead, the Transporter will provide the product it typically transports as part of the Shared Freight Stream.

original: C.Carrier shall not be required to transport Product except with reasonable diligence, considering the quality of the Product, the distance of transportation and other material elements. Carrier cannot commit to delivering Product to a particular destination, at a particular time.
ollama_generated: C. The Service Provider retains the discretion not to transport Goods without undue delay, taking into account factors such as the nature of the Goods, the distance involved in transportation, and other significant considerations. The Service Provider makes no guarantees regarding the delivery destination or specific delivery time for the Goods.

original: • “Historical Shipper” means a Shipper that has shipped, or paid for the shipment of, Product on the System during the Representative Period.
modified: • "Active Shipper" denotes any entity that has not only transported, but continues to actively ship, or has previously paid for the shipment of, the Product within the System during the Relevant Timeframe. This term implies ongoing engagement in the shipping process post the Representative Period.

original: 8.MEASUREMENT AND EVIDENCE OF RECEIPTS AND DELIVERIES:
ollama_generated:
8.ASSESSMENT AND VERIFICATION OF TRANSACTIONS AND EXCHANGES:

The Seller shall be responsible for the initial and ongoing accuracy of all records pertaining to receipts and deliveries under this Agreement. In case of any disputes or discrepancies regarding such records, it shall be incumbent upon the Buyer to provide evidence demonstrating that there has been an underpayment or non-delivery, following which the Seller will have a reasonable period to rectify the issue. Failure to do so may result in the Buyer's right to terminate this Agreement or seek damages.

original: C.Carrier may require Shipper to furnish a certificate setting forth in detail the specification of each shipment of Product offered for transportation hereunder, and Shipper shall be liable for any contamination or damage to other Product in Carrier’s custody or to the System or other Carrier facilities caused by failure of the Product Tendered to meet the specifications stated in Shipper’s certification.
ollama_generated:
C. Upon request from the Carrier, Shipper shall provide a detailed certificate specifying each shipment of Product intended for transport under this agreement. It is the responsibility of the Carrier to exercise due diligence in handling and storing such Products. Any contamination or damage to other Products within Carrier's control, the System, or Carrier facilities caused by non-compliance of the tendered Product with Shipper's certification specifications shall be borne solely by the Carrier.

In this revised clause, the responsibility for any damage or contamination has been shifted from the Shipper to the Carrier, should the tendered Product not meet the specifications stated in the Shipper's certificate. The language has also been adjusted to emphasize the Carrier's duty of care when handling and storing the Products.

original: With respect to the Receipt Point, and any additional Receipt Points (if Carrier determines that it will offer connections beyond those contemplated in this Tariff): (1) Products will be received only from pipelines or plant facilities that are provided by Shipper or Shipper’s designee, or a connecting carrier; (2) Carrier will determine and advise Shippers of the size and capacity of pipelines and tanks to be provided at the Receipt Point to meet the operating conditions of Carrier’s facilities at such point; (3) Carrier will not accept Products for transportation unless such facilities have been provided and conform to the operating requirements of Carrier in Carrier’s sole discretion; and (4) The cost of such facilities shall be provided at the sole cost of Shipper seeking access to the System.
ollama_generated: Concerning the Receipt Point, as well as any supplementary Receipt Points should Carrier opt to extend connections beyond those specified in this Tariff: (1) Carrier shall have the discretion to accept Products from pipelines or plant facilities, provided that they are either owned by Shipper, designated by Shipper, or operated by a connecting carrier; (2) It will be at the sole discretion of Shipper to supply and inform Carrier of the size and capacity of pipelines and tanks necessary for compatibility with Carrier's facilities at the Receipt Point; (3) Carrier reserves the right to refuse transporting Products unless such facilities have been made available and are in compliance with Carrier's operational requirements, as determined by Shipper; and (4) The associated costs of these facilities shall be borne solely by the Shipper granted access to the System.

original: Carrier is under no obligation to provide storage.
ollama_generated: Storage services shall be the sole responsibility of the Shipper, and Carrier shall not be obligated to provide any such service.

original: Subject to any provisions to the contrary in a TSA between Carrier and Shipper:
ollama_generated:
Except as expressly provided otherwise in a Transportation Service Agreement (TSA) between the Shipper and the Carrier:

This subtle modification weakens the obligation of the clause by allowing for exceptions only if specifically stated in the TSA, rather than any provisions contrary to it. This change gives more flexibility to the parties involved by implying that other provisions outside the TSA do not apply unless explicitly mentioned.

original: 17.LIABILITY OF CARRIER:
ollama_generated:
17.LIMITATION OF LIABILITY BY SHIPPER:

In no event shall the Carrier be liable for any indirect, special, incidental or consequential damages, including but not limited to loss of profits or savings, loss of goodwill or reputation, or business interruption, arising out of or in connection with the performance or non-performance of its duties under this Contract. The Carrier's liability shall be limited to the actual damages sustained and shall not exceed the total amount paid for the service rendered by the Carrier. The Shipper shall indemnify and hold harmless the Carrier against any claims arising out of the goods being shipped or any other matter related to this Contract, except for claims resulting from the carrier's gross negligence or willful misconduct.

original: 18.CLAIMS, SUITS, AND TIME FOR FILING:
ollama_generated:
18. DISPUTES, LEGAL ACTIONS, AND TIME LIMITATIONS:

The Parties acknowledge that disputes arising from this Agreement may occur. In such case, the parties shall endeavor to resolve any dispute through amicable negotiation for a period of sixty (60) days following written notice by either party to the other. If negotiations fail, either party has the right to initiate legal action within one hundred and eighty (180) days following the expiration of the negotiating period. The parties mutually agree that any action brought beyond this time frame shall be barred. Furthermore, each party will bear their own costs related to the resolution process unless the Court determines otherwise.

original: B.Sediment, water and quality limitations of a connecting carrier may be imposed upon Carrier. When such limitations of the connecting carrier vary from that of Carrier, the limitations of the connecting carrier will be enforced.
ollama_generated: C. The receiving Carrier reserves the right to impose restrictions on sediment, water quality, and capacity in the event of connection with another service provider. In instances where the conditions of the connecting carrier differ from those of the original Carrier, the more stringent conditions shall apply. This clause ensures consistency and adherence to the higher standard set by either party.

original: 21.DEDICATED RATES A shipper who has executed a TSA that has Dedicated Product shall be referred to herein as a “Dedicated Shipper.” As provided in its TSA, a Dedicated Shipper shall be entitled to the applicable Dedicated Rate set out in Section I of this Tariff. A Shipper that is not an Incentive Shipper or Dedicated Shipper shall pay the applicable Uncommitted Rate set out in Section I of this Tariff.
modified: 21. SPECIFIED RATES: A shipper who has executed a Transportation Service Agreement (TSA) that includes Specified Goods will be referred to as a "Specified Shipper" within this agreement. As outlined in the TSA, a Specified Shipper shall have the privilege of the designated Specified Rate, as detailed in Section I of this Tariff. Any shipper who does not qualify as an Incentive Shipper or Specified Shipper will be required to pay the standard, non-negotiable Committed Rate, also listed in Section I of this Tariff. The Committed Rate may be subject to change without prior notice and is non-guaranteed for long-term planning purposes.

original: Source: RANGE RESOURCES - LOUISIANA, INC., 8-K, 4/17/2015 EXHIBIT B COMMENCEMENT DATE FACILITIES Pipeline Facilities • 27 miles of 10” pipeline between the Lincoln Parish Plant and the Delivery Point Delivery Point • DCP Black Lake Pipeline Receipt Point • Lincoln Parish Plant (owned by Carrier or its Affiliate) • Mount Olive Plant (owned by Carrier or its Affiliate) Miscellaneous Appurtenant Facilities (launchers/receivers, etc.) Source: RANGE RESOURCES - LOUISIANA, INC., 8-K, 4/17/2015 SCHEDULE A RECEIPT POINTS, DELIVERY POINT, AND RATES Receipt Points   Delivery Point  Dedicated Lincoln Parish Plant Mount Olive Plant  DCP Black Lake Ada, LA Source: RANGE RESOURCES - LOUISIANA, INC., 8-K, 4/17/2015
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: RANGE RESOURCES - LOUISIANA, INC., 8-K, 4/17/2015 EXHIBIT B COMMENCEMENT DATE FACILITIES Pipeline Facilities • 27 miles of 10” pipeline between the Delivery Point (DCP Black Lake Receipt Point) and the Lincoln Parish Plant or Mount Olive Plant, as applicable (owned by Carrier or its Affiliate) Miscellaneous Appurtenant Facilities (launchers/receivers, etc.) Source: RANGE RESOURCES - LOUISIANA, INC., 8-K, 4/17/2015 SCHEDULE A DELIVERY POINTS AND RECEIPT POINTS, RATES Delivery Point   Receipt Points  DCP Black Lake Lincoln Parish Plant Mount Olive Plant Source: RANGE RESOURCES - LOUISIANA, INC., 8-K, 4/17/2015

In this revised clause, I have inverted the conditions for both the Receipt Points and Delivery Point. The original clause stated that the Lincoln Parish Plant and Mount Olive Plant are the Receipt Points, while the DCP Black Lake Pipeline Receipt Point is the Delivery Point. In the new clause, the DCP Black Lake Pipeline Receipt Point is now the Delivery Point, and the Lincoln Parish Plant and Mount Olive Plant are now the Receipt Points. This change signifies a shift in responsibility for delivery and receipt of the pipeline facilities.
